papers.title: Coupling between collective modes in the deformed $^{98}\mathrm{Zr}$ nucleus: Insights from consistent $\mathrm{HFB}+\mathrm{QRPA}$ calculations with the Gogny interaction
papers.authors: E. V. Chimanski, E. J. In, S. Péru, A. Thapa, W. Younes, and J. E. Escher
papers.summary: Author(s): E. V. Chimanski, E. J. In, S. Péru, A. Thapa, W. Younes, and J. E. EscherThe zirconium isotopes exhibit structural properties that present multiple challenges to nuclear theory. Investigations of the coupling present within isoscalar modes and within isovector modes are scarce but important for advancing our understanding of the microscopic picture of nuclei. To explore …[Phys. Rev. C 111, 054314] Published Fri May 16, 2025

papers.title: Thermal properties of zero sound in asymmetrical nuclear matter
papers.summary: Author(s): Jing Ye and Wei-Zhou JiangThe zero-sound modes at finite temperature are investigated with the relativistic random phase approximation to signal the uncertainty of the equation of state (EOS) of asymmetrical nuclear matter. papers.title: Coulomb and nuclear breakup of $^{11}\mathrm{Be}$ using an effective-potential theory description at ${\mathrm{N}}^{2}\mathrm{LO}$
papers.summary: Author(s): L.-P. Kubushishi and P. CapelBackground: Halo effective field theory (Halo-EFT) provides a very efficient description of loosely bound nuclei in models of reaction. papers.title: Relative abundance of correlated spin-zero nucleon pairs
papers.authors: Raz Yankovich, Ehoud Pazy, and Nir Barnea
papers.summary: Author(s): Raz Yankovich, Ehoud Pazy, and Nir BarneaWe utilize the generalized contact formalism in conjunction with the Woods-Saxon mean-field description of the long-range part of the nuclear wave function to assess the relative prevalence of short-range correlation pairs within atomic nuclei.
